adrFormatAddress: 2534 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA

editorialSummary.text: Louisiana-inspired fast-food chain known for its spicy fried chicken, biscuits & sides.

originalText.text: Just wow…wow out of the world experience. From the atmosphere and the setting it blew me back will be returning daily. I got the Mac n cheese and I almost climaxed while the cheese melt in my mouth. At taste of Louisiana cooking in New York the chef must be a prodigy of his time to create such a delicate and well crafted meal. The flavors worked in unison the hit spot of my mouth.

text.text: Just wow…wow out of the world experience. From the atmosphere and the setting it blew me back will be returning daily. I got the Mac n cheese and I almost climaxed while the cheese melt in my mouth. At taste of Louisiana cooking in New York the chef must be a prodigy of his time to create such a delicate and well crafted meal. The flavors worked in unison the hit spot of my mouth.

originalText.text:
Chicken was cold/warm. When it's that temperature, the flavors are "off." Also the chicken wing was so small, I had to talk myself into eating it, as well as the leg. The breast was their regular size.

Apple pies were warm/hot and delicious!

Love the strawberry soda, but even the small cup of soda cost over $3.

The prices have skyrocketed so much, I was only the eitgth person in line at that late hour on a Friday night, on what I call a payday weekend.

A three piece, small rice & beans, two apple pies, small soda cost $19 and change. Last week, a friend called me complaining about how much a two piece and a biscuit cost. She couldn't believe it. EVERYTHING, everywhere, has increased tremendously, in price.

Think I'll return to cooking... After a break!

originalText.text:
Besides the Popeyes on Canal & Bowery, just before the Manhattan bridge, this has been my go to since it opened.

It gets a 4 because:

The service doesn’t come with attitude
The food is always consistent
Cleaner than most Popeyes in the city

Cons:

Freelance doormen
Unhinged/ ratchet malakas are minimal, but they still there

originalText.text: This place used to be good but then they started serving white meat for the 2 piece combos.  You can't choose white vs dark meat on Seamless so it's a bit of a gamble on what you get. They used to be consistent with serving only dark meat for the 2 piece but now it's all DRY breast or wings.  Terrible. Won't be ordering from here again.

originalText.text: This particular one is very old and dirty, there are almost homeless people at the door or inside. Also the person was very tired and they have to do a lot of things at the same time so you won't get any attention
